member.name: T:System.Console
member.summary: Represents the standard input, output, and error streams for console applications. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: P:System.Console.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the console.
member.returns: A value that specifies the background color of the console; that is, the color that appears behind each character. The default is black.
member.exception: The color specified in a set operation is not a valid member of .
The user does not have permission to perform this action.
An I/O error occurred.

member.name: M:System.Console.Beep
member.summary: Plays the sound of a beep through the console speaker.
member.exception: This method was executed on a server, such as SQL Server, that does not permit access to a user interface.

member.name: M:System.Console.Beep(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays the sound of a beep of a specified frequency and duration through the console speaker.
member.param: The frequency of the beep, ranging from 37 to 32767 hertz.
The duration of the beep measured in milliseconds.
member.exception: is less than 37 or more than 32767 hertz. -or- is less than or equal to zero.
This method was executed on a server, such as SQL Server, that does not permit access to the console.
The current operating system is not Windows.

member.name: E:System.Console.CancelKeyPress
member.summary: Occurs when the modifier key (Ctrl) and either the console key (C) or the Break key are pressed simultaneously (Ctrl+C or Ctrl+Break).

member.returns: The height of the largest possible console window measured in rows.

member.name: P:System.Console.LargestWindowWidth
member.summary: Gets the largest possible number of console window columns, based on the current font and screen resolution.
member.returns: The width of the largest possible console window measured in columns.

member.name: M:System.Console.ReadKey
member.summary: Obtains the next character or function key pressed by the user. The pressed key is displayed in the console window.
member.returns: An object that describes the constant and Unicode character, if any, that correspond to the pressed console key. The object also describes, in a bitwise combination of values, whether one or more Shift, Alt, or Ctrl modifier keys was pressed simultaneously with the console key.
member.exception: The property is redirected from some stream other than the console.

member.name: M:System.Console.ReadKey(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Obtains the next character or function key pressed by the user. The pressed key is optionally displayed in the console window.
member.param: Determines whether to display the pressed key in the console window. to not display the pressed key; otherwise, .
member.returns: An object that describes the constant and Unicode character, if any, that correspond to the pressed console key. The object also describes, in a bitwise combination of values, whether one or more Shift, Alt, or Ctrl modifier keys was pressed simultaneously with the console key.
member.exception: The property is redirected from some stream other than the console.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleCancelEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleCancelEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether simultaneously pressing the modifier key and the console key (Ctrl+C) or the Ctrl+Break keys terminates the current process. The default is , which terminates the current process.
member.returns: if the current process should resume when the event handler concludes; if the current process should terminate. The default value is ; the current process terminates when the event handler returns. If , the current process continues.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleCancelEventArgs.SpecialKey
member.summary: Gets the combination of modifier and console keys that interrupted the current process.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the key combination that interrupted the current process. There is no default value.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleCancelEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .
member.param: The source of the event.
A object that contains the event data.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleColor
member.summary: Specifies constants that define foreground and background colors for the console.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleKeyInfo
member.summary: Describes the console key that was pressed, including the character represented by the console key and the state of the SHIFT, ALT, and CTRL modifier keys.

member.name: M:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.#ctor(System.Char,System.ConsoleKey,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure using the specified character, console key, and modifier keys.
member.param: The Unicode character that corresponds to the parameter.
The console key that corresponds to the parameter.
to indicate that a SHIFT key was pressed; otherwise, .
to indicate that an ALT key was pressed; otherwise, .
to indicate that a CTRL key was pressed; otherwise, .
member.exception: The numeric value of the parameter is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.name: M:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.Equals(System.ConsoleKeyInfo)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
member.param: An object to compare to the current object.
member.returns: if is equal to the current object; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
member.param: An object to compare to the current object.
member.returns: if is a object and is equal to the current object; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for the current object.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.Key
member.summary: Gets the console key represented by the current object.
member.returns: A value that identifies the console key that was pressed.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.KeyChar
member.summary: Gets the Unicode character represented by the current object.
member.returns: An object that corresponds to the console key represented by the current object.

member.name: P:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.Modifiers
member.summary: Gets a bitwise combination of values that specifies one or more modifier keys pressed simultaneously with the console key.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of the enumeration values. There is no default value.

member.name: M:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.op_Equality(System.ConsoleKeyInfo,System.ConsoleKeyInfo)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified objects are equal.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: if is equal to ; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.ConsoleKeyInfo.op_Inequality(System.ConsoleKeyInfo,System.ConsoleKeyInfo)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified objects are not equal.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: if is not equal to ; otherwise, .

member.name: T:System.ConsoleModifiers
member.summary: Represents the SHIFT, ALT, and CTRL modifier keys on a keyboard.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleModifiers.Alt
member.summary: The left or right ALT modifier key.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleModifiers.Control
member.summary: The left or right CTRL modifier key.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleModifiers.Shift
member.summary: The left or right SHIFT modifier key.

member.name: T:System.ConsoleSpecialKey
member.summary: Specifies combinations of modifier and console keys that can interrupt the current process.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleSpecialKey.ControlBreak
member.summary: The modifier key plus the BREAK console key.

member.name: F:System.ConsoleSpecialKey.ControlC
member.summary: The modifier key plus the console key.
